availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Crouch (Edmonson County, Kentucky, tavern attendant, constable, and soldier)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, tavern attendant, constable, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married Sarah Crouch. Father of Polly A. Crouch, Felix A. Crouch, Mary A. Crouch, M. J. Crouch, Olivia Crouch, Bell Crouch, Sarah A. Crouch, and Susan Crouch. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1850. Tavern attendant in Edmonson County in 1860. Constable in Edmonson County in 1863. Sergeant in the 48th Volunteer Infantry Regiment from October 1863 and December 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 10; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 85; Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0444; KYR-0001-029-0531.
